intro: Tridactyle gabonensis, commonly known as the Gabon tridactyle, is a flowering plant native to Central Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Tridactyle gabonensis is often found in forested areas and is adapted to the humid, tropical climate of its native habitat.
